metadata.title: CVE-2023-52424 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: The IEEE 802.11 standard sometimes enables an adversary to trick a victiminto connecting to an unintended or untrusted network with Home WEP, HomeWPA3 SAE-loop. Enterprise 802.1X/EAP, Mesh AMPE, or FILS, aka an "SSIDConfusion" issue. This occurs because the SSID is not always used to derivethe pairwise master key or session keys, and because there is not aprotected exchange of an SSID during a 4-way handshake.

criterions.comment: wpa package in xenial is affected, but a decision has been made to defer addressing it (note: '2024-05-20').
